intro: Epidendrum bogotense, commonly known as the Bogotá Epidendrum, is a member of the Orchidaceae family native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a terrestrial orchid with tall, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of white or grayish hairs. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, showy flowers in shades of white, yellow, and green, typically blooming during the dry season. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate to high light exposure. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
